intro: Hieracium arvonense, commonly known as the Arvon hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, particularly found in grassy areas and meadows. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. Hieracium arvonense is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
